text: Château Duhart-Milon, previously also Château Duhart-Milon-Rothschild, is a winery in the Pauillac appellation of the Bordeaux region of France. The wine produced here was classified as one of ten Quatrièmes Crus Classés (Fourth Growths) in the historic Bordeaux Wine Official Classification of 1855.Karen MacNeil (2001). The Wine Bible. Workman Publishing. . p. 885. The Château has planted with Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. The Château produces a second wine under the label Moulin de Duhart. It is managed by Charles Chevallier, general manager at Château Lafite Rothschild.J. Suckling (March 31, 2007). "50 Best Bordeaux under $50". Wine Spectator Magazine. p. 74. == References == == External links == *Château Duhart-Milon site Category:Bordeaux wine producers Category:Rothschild family residences
title: Château Duhart-Milon
